unit_learning_outcomes.description: demonstrate the skills required to undertake research across a broad range of topics in astrophysics.
critically evaluate scientific outcomes in light of applied analysis techniques.
independently solve complex computational and technical problems related to astronomy research projects.
apply advanced knowledge of fundamental analysis techniques used in astronomy research.
effectively communicate the results of astronomical research in written and oral form.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Working on projects, including ad-hoc weekly meeting with unit convener and project mentors

assessments.description: A oral report to the cohort on one of the projects.
A report of the fourth of four projects undertaken during the unit
A report of the third of four projects undertaken during the unit
A report of the first of four projects undertaken during the unit
A report of the second of four projects undertaken during the unit

data.subject_search_title: ASTR7913 - Contemporary Research Techniques in Astrophysics
data.description: This unit will introduce students to fundamental analysis techniques used in contemporary astrophysics. Students will undertake a series of projects in which they will reproduce key recent results from research papers. The projects will span a range of potential topics from radio astronomy, instrumentation, high resolution optical spectroscopy of stars, spatially resolved spectroscopy of galaxies, quantitative structure of galaxies, analysis of large survey data, and computational theory. After completion of this unit, students will possess the skills required to undertake a range of advanced research projects.
